sentences.en: An umpire stands behind the catcher in baseball.
sentences.cn: 棒球比赛时,裁判员站在接球手的身后.
他过去担任棒球比赛的裁判。

sentences.en: He was the only National League umpire to wear an outside chest protector.
sentences.cn: 他是唯一在衣服外面穿护胸的全国联赛裁判。

sentences.en: He yammered at an umpire loudly enough to get himself tossed out of a game.
sentences.cn: 他大声埋怨裁判,结果被逐出比赛.

sentences.en: I called the umpire a bum.
sentences.cn: 我认为裁判是个不中用的家伙.

sentences.en: The boys had an altercation over the umpire's decision.
sentences.cn: 男孩子们对裁判的判决颇有争议.

sentences.en: The tennis umpire wore an eye - shade.
sentences.cn: 那网球裁判戴着遮光帽檐.

sentences.en: The umpire gave the batsman out ( leg before wicket ).
sentences.cn: 裁判裁定击球员 ( 用腿截球违例 ) 出局.

sentences.en: The umpire ruled that the batsman was out.
sentences.cn: 裁判员裁定击球手出局.

sentences.en: The umpire saw fair between both sides.
The umpire showed partiality for that team.

sentences.cn: 裁判的裁定是不可更改的。

sentences.en: They refused to accept the umpire's decision.
sentences.cn: 他们拒绝接受裁判员的判决.

words.tran_cn: 仲裁；公断；仲裁人之地位

trans.tran_en: the person who makes sure that the players obey the rules in sports such as tennis, baseball, and cricket
to be the umpire in a game or competition
